clintock:AdenineKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Nucleobase indicated by the color blue.

clintock:BindKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Binding a nucleobase puts it in your first empty slot, consuming a Deoxyribose and Phosphate in the process. If you have no empty slots, an amino acid forms from the nucleotides and joins the peptide chain.

clintock:CytosineKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Nucleobase indicated by the color red.

clintock:FluorophoreKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Increases the potency of Bound Nucleobases.

clintock:GuanineKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Nucleobase indicated by the color green.

clintock:NucleobaseKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Fundamental units of the genetic code found in DNA (Adenine, Cytosine, Guanine, Thymine).

clintock:NucleosideKeyword.DESCRIPTION: A Nucleobase linked to a sugar. Does not require Deoxyribose when Binding.

clintock:PhosphateKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Phosphorus bound to 4 oxygen residues. NL Essential molecule in generating nucleotides.

clintock:SugarKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Specifically deoxyribose. NL Essential molecule in generating nucleotides.

clintock:ThymineKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Nucleobase indicated by the color yellow.
